title: myGov scams (fake websites/apps, credential harvesting)
summary: Scammers create fake myGov lookalike sites/apps to steal usernames, passwords, PINs, and other details.
how_it_works: You’re sent a link to a ‘myGov’ login page.
The site/app looks real but is fake.
Entered details are stolen and used for fraud/identity theft.
warning_signs: Link in message leads to a login page.
Requests for myGov PIN/secret questions/TFN in suspicious contexts.
example_hooks: “New message in your inbox—log in now.”
what_to_do: Access myGov by typing my.gov.au yourself or using the official myGov app.
Never log in via links you didn’t request.
Change your password if you entered it on a suspicious page.

quick_quiz.q: What’s the safest way to get to the real website?
choices: Click the link in the message
Type the website address yourself or use the official app
Reply and ask them for another link
quick_quiz.explain: Scam messages often include links to fake sites. Typing the address yourself (or using the official app) reduces that risk.

quick_quiz.q: A message says you must act 'within 24 hours' or you'll lose access. What should you do first?
choices: Stop and verify using official contact details you find yourself
Forward it to friends to ask
quick_quiz.explain: Urgency is a classic pressure tactic. Verify using trusted contact details.
